facts: An apple can help you wake up better than coffee.
Honey never spoils. 3000-year-old honey was found in Egyptian pyramids.
Strawberries are not berries, they belong to the rose family.
Potatoes can absorb and reflect WiFi signals.
Chocolate was used as currency by ancient Maya and Aztec civilizations.
Tomatoes are botanically fruits but legally classified as vegetables.
Bananas are slightly radioactive due to potassium.
Carrots were originally purple. Orange carrots were developed by the Dutch in the 17th century.
Coconut water can be used as blood plasma in emergencies.
Watermelon is 92% water.
Oranges contain less vitamin C than apples.
Vanilla is the only edible fruit from the orchid family.
Avocado is actually a fruit, technically a berry.
Peanuts grow underground, not on trees.
Coffee beans are actually seeds of a fruit.
Broccoli is actually an edible flower.
It takes 2-3 years for a pineapple to ripen.
Lemons contain more sugar than strawberries.
Honey is a natural antibiotic that kills bacteria.
Garlic is actually a vegetable from the onion family.
Mango is the world's most consumed fruit.
Potato was the first vegetable grown in space in 1995.
An avocado contains more potassium than a banana.
Cherries and peaches are fruits from the rose family.
Mustard seed is one of the world's oldest spices.
Most wasabi is actually dyed horseradish. Real wasabi is very expensive.
A kiwi contains twice as much vitamin C as an orange.
Ginger has been used as medicine for over 5000 years.
Eggplant is technically a fruit.
Cabbage is 91% water.
China produces 80% of the world's garlic.
Cinnamon is actually tree bark.
Black pepper was known as 'black gold' in ancient times.
Mint has over 600 varieties worldwide.
Turmeric is a powerful spice with anti-inflammatory properties.
A cup of broccoli contains more calcium than a glass of milk.
Spinach becomes more nutritious when cooked.
The reason you cry when cutting onions is sulfenic acid.
Chocolate can be toxic to dogs.
Blueberries are one of the richest fruits in antioxidants.
Grapefruit can interact with certain medications.
Artichoke is actually a thistle.
The change in urine smell after eating asparagus is genetic.
Radishes can be harvested in just 3 weeks.
Saffron is the world's most expensive spice, over $10,000 per kilogram.
An apple eaten in the morning provides energy, while eaten at night helps sleep.
Walnuts resemble the brain and are beneficial for brain health.
Chewing celery burns more calories than it contains.
Pasta came to Italy from China.
Capsaicin in peppers creates a burning sensation but doesn't damage tissue.
Green, yellow, and red peppers are the same vegetable at different stages of ripeness.
Dates are a natural energy source and rich in potassium.
Olives are drupes, not regular fruits.
Rice is the staple food for more than half of the world's population.
Eggshells are porous and can absorb odors.
Bee pollen is one of nature's most nutritious foods.
Dark chocolate can help lower blood pressure.
Garlic should be consumed for heart health, not vampire protection.
Pumpkin seeds are rich in zinc.
Kefir is richer in probiotics than yogurt.
Wheat has been cultivated for over 10,000 years.
Walnut oil is very rich in Omega-3 fatty acids.
Almonds are actually seeds from the peach family.
Coconut can technically be a fruit, seed, and nut.
Lentils are one of the oldest cultivated crops.
Chicken egg color depends on the chicken's feather color.
Salmon's pink color comes from the shellfish it eats.
Green tea and black tea come from the same plant, just processed differently.
Cacao beans are bitter before fermentation.
The banana plant is actually a type of herb, not a tree.
Bees visit 4 million flowers to produce one kilogram of honey.
Orange peel contains more vitamin C than the fruit itself.
Red wine contains the antioxidant resveratrol.
Yogurt is a Turkish-origin word used worldwide.
Milk is essentially filtered blood.
Cheese has been made since 8000 BC.
A honey bee produces only 1/12 teaspoon of honey in its lifetime.
India is the world's largest spice producer.
Chickpeas have been consumed by humans for 7500 years.
Soybeans have the most complete amino acid profile among plant protein sources.
waitMessages: Almost there, thanks for your patience...

findings.medium_ambiguous: {{keyword}} could be a potential source of {{source}}.

disclaimer.title: LEGAL DISCLAIMER
disclaimer.text: This analysis is generated by AI and does not constitute medical advice. Results are based on general database matches and are not guaranteed to be accurate. If you have allergen risks, please check the product label and consult your doctor.

family.title: Family Profiles
family.desc: Create profiles for your child or spouse to customize analysis.
family.emptyDesc: Add family members to analyze foods based on their dietary needs.

scan.rotationLockHint: Not rotating? Disable rotation lock in phone settings

scan.frameSubtitleLandscape: Position the ingredient list within the scan area
